programme.title: NFL Game Re-Airs
programme.desc: Hines Ward made eight catches for 159 yards and a touchdown, Santonio Holmes had five for 104 and tight end Heath Miller caught his fourth TD pass in three games. From Week 6, 2009.

programme.title: NFL Throwback
programme.desc: From Brett Favre against the Packers to Joe Montana facing the 49ers, watch the 10 biggest revenge games ever.

programme.title: NFL Top 10
programme.desc: From Spygate to Brett Favre's return to Green Bay, the 10 best grudge matches in NFL history.

programme.title: NFL Game Re-Airs
programme.desc: Randy Moss and the Minnesota Vikings torch the Dallas Cowboys during the Week 13 of the 1998 NFL season.

programme.title: NFL Game Re-Airs
programme.desc: Relive the Baltimore Ravens' big 38-10 win over the Carolina Panthers in Week 4 of the 2021 season. WR Steve Smith Sr. gets payback against his former team in a big way, going off for 139 yards and 2 TDs on 7 receptions.

programme.title: A Football Life
programme.desc: The story of the mercurial wide receiver as he recovers from a career-threatening injury and reflects on his playing career.

programme.title: NFL Game Re-Airs
programme.desc: Defensive end Leonard Williams intercepted Aaron Rodgers and his 92-yard return for a momentum-turning score in the second quarter helped the Seahawks come back and defeat the New York Jets 26-21 on Sunday.

programme.title: NFL Game Re-Airs
programme.desc: Jalen Hurts scored on two tush-push quarterback sneaks and threw a 41-yard touchdown pass to A.J. Brown as the Eagles (4-2) beat the Giants (2-5) for the sixth time in seven games and 14th in 17. Philadelphia's defense was just as good, recording eight sacks and limiting New York to 119 yards. Eagles RB Saquon Barkley rushed for 176 yards and a TD in a memorable return as the Eagles blitz the Giants 28-3.

programme.title: NFL Top 10
programme.desc: From Spygate to Brett Favre's return to Green Bay, the 10 best grudge matches in NFL history.

programme.title: NFL Throwback
programme.desc: From Brett Favre against the Packers to Joe Montana facing the 49ers, watch the 10 biggest revenge games ever.

programme.title: NFL Game Re-Airs
programme.desc: Peyton Manning is back in Indianapolis, but Colts quarterback Andrew Luck threw three touchdown passes and ran for another score Sunday night, handing the Denver Broncos a 39-33 loss.

programme.title: NFL Game Re-Airs
programme.desc: Tom Brady makes his highly-anticipated return to New England as the Tampa Bay Buccaneers visit the Patriots.

programme.title: NFL Throwback
programme.desc: From Brett Favre against the Packers to Joe Montana facing the 49ers, watch the 10 biggest revenge games ever.

programme.title: NFL Top 10
programme.desc: From Spygate to Brett Favre's return to Green Bay, the 10 best grudge matches in NFL history.

programme.title: NFL 360
programme.desc: Raiders linebacker Carl Nassib comes out as gay and helps transform lives, and Super Bowl champion Osi Umenyiora helps Nigerian prospects escape dramatic hardships.

programme.title: NFL Explained
programme.desc: It's time to unwrap the history of NFL rivalries and the divisions that helped create so many of them. Sit back and watch all the craziest, most heated moments that have led to so much ill will between teams and their fans.

programme.title: NFL Top 10
programme.desc: From Spygate to Brett Favre's return to Green Bay, the 10 best grudge matches in NFL history.

programme.title: Super Bowl Classics
programme.desc: Tom Brady passes for 236 yards and two touchdowns to lead the Patriots to victory over the Eagles. From Feb. 6, 2005 in Jacksonville, Fla.

programme.title: Super Bowl Classics
programme.desc: Nick Foles and the underdog Eagles battle with the defending Super Bowl champion Patriots in a memorable matchup as the Eagles triumph and win their first championship in franchise history. From Feb. 4, 2018.

programme.title: America's Game: The Super Bowl Champions
programme.desc: The journey of the 2017 Philadelphia Eagles through the regular season and on to the Super Bowl.

programme.title: Super Bowl Classic Games
programme.desc: Patrick Mahomes led the Kansas City Chiefs to a 38-35 victory over the Philadelphia Eagles with two fourth-quarter touchdown passes and a decisive 26-yard scramble. The Chiefs won their second NFL title in four years and two-time NFL MVP Mahomes earned his second Super Bowl MVP award.

programme.title: Super Bowl Classics
programme.desc: From Feb. 12, 2023.

programme.title: 2025 Tewaaraton Award Ceremony
programme.desc: From the Smithsonian National Museum of the American Indian in Washington, DC, comes the 25th annual Tewaaraton Award Ceremony. programme.title: World Series of Poker
programme.desc: Just 50 players return on Day 6 of the WSOP Main Event as Marcel Luske headlines the feature table along with John Murphy. On the outer tables, Josh Arieh and David Williams begin their run up the leaderboard, while previous champions Chris Ferguson and Dan Harrington remain in contention as just 32 players remain.

programme.title: World Series of Poker
programme.desc: There are 32 players remaining on Day 6 of the WSOP Main Event. Chip leader Greg Raymer headlines the feature table along with Josh Arieh and Dan Harrington. The elimination of Chris Ferguson leaves Harrington as the sole Main Event champion remaining, while the field is reduced to just 17 players.

programme.title: World Series of Poker
programme.desc: The WSOP Main Event plays down to the final table as former champion Dan Harrington, along with Dutchman Marcel Luske look to make a run at being one of the final nine. Plenty of others will fall short, but who will reach the 2004 WSOP Main Event final table?

programme.title: World Series of Poker
programme.desc: The final table of the 2004 WSOP Main Event sees Greg Raymer hold the chip lead ahead of Matt Dean, Josh Arieh, Glenn Hughes, Dan Harrington, David Williams, Al Krux, Mike McLain, and Mattias Andersson. All eyes are on the $5 million first-place pirze and the title of 2004 World Champion.

programme.title: Thick Trip

programme.title: Unsecured
programme.desc: Bobby, haunted by the infidelity of his ex-wife, enters a new relationship with Lakeisha while grappling with deep-seated insecurities. Unbeknownst to Lakeisha, his past resurfaces when a witness claims to have seen him involved in a murder.

programme.title: The Foreign Exchange Student
programme.desc: A troubled high schooler is sent to America on exchange when she is suspected of murder, but soon wreaks havoc on her host family.

programme.title: The Foreign Exchange Student 2:The Hunt
programme.desc: Mr. and Mrs. Nelson are excited to be getting two new foreign exchange students to live with them. Then, a chain of murders starts to happen again in the city of Houston. They suspect the murders may be connected to Sinclair's death.

programme.title: The Legend of Doc Mays
programme.desc: The story of Dwayne "Doc" Mays, born in North Carolina and raised in Chicago by his streetwise mother. After the death of his mother when he was 8 years old, he found himself a ward of the foster system, ultimately leading to a life on the streets and of crime. When he meets his future mentor "Street" he would rise to be one of the most notorious gangsters in Chicago's history of organized crime.

programme.title: Aliens in the Hood
programme.desc: The hood politics of the neighborhood become even more complicated after the arrival of aliens. When one man in the neighborhood is blessed with superpowers, he and the other warring factions are headed to war over control of the current drug trade.

programme.title: Toxic Traits
programme.desc: A young couple meet and fall in love, but a mother becomes suspicious of the girlfriend’s behavior and tries to uncover her true nature.

programme.title: The Saved and the Salacious
programme.desc: Ashton, Isaac, and Terrell aim for gospel music fame, but clash with Titan Records' shady founder, Rodney.

programme.title: The Only Child
programme.desc: A car accident that kills her mom rips apart the childhood of a 12-year-old girl who isn’t about to let his dad’s new girlfriend take her place.

programme.title: Three Secrets
programme.desc: A couple tries to bring life back into their marriage by bringing in another woman, but the relationship is built on lies.

programme.title: The 4th Quarter: Legacy
programme.desc: After failing to make the playoffs last year, an aging quarterback returns for a make-or-break season while putting his broken family back together.

programme.title: Targeted
programme.desc: After escaping from a mental institution, a young woman secures a job that allows her to pursue her dangerous obsession with a crush from her past.

programme.title: Kitty Hallow Killer
programme.desc: A serial killer is on the loose in Houston killing pedophiles and rapists. When Mason and Jessica get into a horrible car accident on their wedding day, Jessica wakes up with no memory of her life or even her husband. As her memories start to come back in pieces, she is afraid that her husband, Mason, could be The Kitty Hallow Killer.

programme.title: Dreamer on Dreamer 2
programme.desc: Derrick attempts to break it off with his side-chick Keisha, but she thought she was his one and only. That is until she finds out about his fiancé Crystal. To get revenge, Keisha decides to befriend Crystal.

programme.title: Priceless: The Dawn
programme.desc: Music legends Donica and Shequell's plan to start their own record label puts a target on their backs in unexpected ways.

programme.title: Droppin Bodies
programme.desc: Julia, a mother haunted by a violent past, flees her old life to protect her daughter, Kelsey. But when Kelsey is tragically murdered by her boyfriend, Julia is left shattered and betrayed. Abandoned by a justice system that fails to bring her daughter's killer to account, she's forced to confront the darkness she once escaped.

programme.title: Triangle Slave
programme.desc: After rising to the top of the drug game in Philadelphia, two brothers find their empire threatened when a woman comes between them.

programme.title: Wannabe a Star
programme.desc: This time, everything is upgraded. New students, new location and new problems for Dr. Cool. Lardel has hired a spy to watch him, his hustle is beginning to unravel, and family is becoming uneasy, and his heart is feeling conviction.

programme.title: Ultimatums
programme.desc: A sexually frustrated woman struggles to be faithful to her fiancé when a new house guest arrives who has an ulterior motive of his own.

programme.title: White Lies
programme.desc: Two childhood friends partner on a lucrative hustle, oblivious to its true danger. Matters become more complicated after one develops feelings for the other's husband.

programme.title: Weapons of Warfare
programme.desc: Raised in a religious household, a young man decides to pursue a life on the street, only to be torn between his family and the leader of his gang.

programme.title: Vampire Genesis
programme.desc: Half-alien Teh'a flees across galaxies, hunted by a race of parasitic rulers disguised as Earth's vampires. With rebels by her side, she seeks a legendary creature: the first vampire, powerful enough to end their reign of terror.

programme.title: Single Black Female

programme.title: The Pulse With Bill Anderson
programme.desc: The Pulse with Bill Anderson is a weekly tv program and podcast featuring topical discussions and interviews surrounding current local issues, events, and entertainment. Each week Bill will welcome guests from all walks of life to talk about the topics that have the attention of our community and beyond. The Pulse will air weekly on FOX 29 in Philly as well as FOX Soul nationwide and be distributed on all major podcast outlets. In addition to hosting The Pulse Bill also manages the content of the station's special reports, including the Our Race Reality series of segments and specials. He also reports on the brighter side of life in his regular news series For Goodness' Sake.

programme.desc: Hoppy discovers that a banker is in league with a gang of outlaws trying to cheat a retired professor out of his silver-rich land.

programme.title: Hopalong Cassidy
programme.desc: Hoppy and the Bar 20 boys get involved in one of their most treacherous mysteries yet when they agree to help a girl locate her missing father along the border.

programme.title: Hopalong Cassidy

programme.title: Stories of the Century
programme.desc: After a robbery by the Doolin gang, Matt interviews a mortally wounded Ed Brinkley regarding the Doolin hideout in Oklahoma. Frankie shows up pretending to be Ed's widow.

programme.title: Stories of the Century
programme.desc: In order to be with her outlaw lover, Little Britches turns outlaw, and the two rob a bank. Matt investigates the bank robbery and gives chase with Frankie.

programme.title: Stories of the Century

programme.title: Stories of the Century
programme.desc: Matt and Frankie see Matt's old friend Tom Horn while investigating a cattle dispute in Wyoming. When a young homesteader is killed the detectives see evidence add up against Horn.

programme.title: Stories of the Century

programme.title: Stories of the Century
programme.desc: During a robbery Frankie is shot as she pulls the mask off her assailant. Matt arrests John Allison, after Frankie's life is endangered when her doctor is kidnapped.

programme.title: Stories of the Century
programme.desc: A train is robbed and money stolen. Matt Clark and Margaret Jones investigate. And then a shipment of dynamite is also reported missing,

programme.title: Stories of the Century

programme.title: Stories of the Century

programme.title: Stories of the Century
programme.desc: Young Charles Ward has disappeared while traveling in Kansas leading detectives Matt and Margaret to discover why. The local sheriff reports others missing.

programme.title: Wild Rovers
programme.desc: Tired of his job at a ranch owned by Walter Buckman (Karl Malden), Frank Post (Ryan O'Neal) wants to pull a heist, and when his much older coworker, Ross Bodine (William Holden), sees nothing better on the horizon, the cowboys agree to team up for the crime. After filling their pockets with loot from a local bank, Frank and Ross ride toward what they hope is freedom. But the younger Buckmans, Paul (Joe Don Baker) and John (Tom Skerritt), pursue them over the rough land of the Southwest.

programme.title: Yancy Derringer
programme.desc: New Orleans' underworld conspires to rub out administrator Colton right when Colton's sister Agatha finally arrives on a visit. Yancy expected a Boston battle-ax, but he's smitten with her charm and wit. Colton has a heavy workload, fending off crime czar Lance Carter, and wowing Agatha with his Reconstruction wizardry, while building a romantic blockade between her and Yancy.

programme.title: Yancy Derringer
programme.desc: Mr. Proctor, a friend of the Derringer family, is sent to New Orleans with a message from a former general in the Civil War. But before he is able to relay the message to Yancy, Mr. Proctor is assassinated, leaving Yancy to uncover the mystery behind the Confederate half dollar Mr. Proctor was carrying when he died.

programme.desc: Adam is wounded while protecting a woman against a group of Indians who believed she was a mountain spirit, and the woman nurses him back to health.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Darlene is in for one surprise after another when David introduces his girlfriend, Blue (Juliette Lewis), and mentions that Mark and Harris will be spending the weekend with them.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: It's Halloween, the favorite time of year for the Conners, but an email from the school banning certain costumes, including Mark's, sets off an argument between Dan and Darlene.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Geena learns D.J. hasn't been taking Mary to church while she's been away, so she insists they go as a family.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: A family member drops a life-changing announcement; Dan suspects that Becky isn't sticking to her end of the deal about her drinking; Darlene continues her job search.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: With Mark and Mary's help, Jackie convinces Dan to build a chicken coop so the family can eat organic eggs.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Dan questions Peter's motives when he learns about the pricey Christmas gift Jackie bought for her new unemployed beau. Elsewhere, Mark and Mary write up their Christmas wish list.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: When Becky helps Harris keep a secret from Darlene, it causes a split between the two sisters.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: When Dan gets injured on the job covering D.J.'s vending machine route, the choice to sue the company could lead to D.J. getting fired.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: When Ben offers Mark free piano lessons, Darlene finds this as an opportunity to test his parenting skills. Meanwhile, Jackie throws Becky a baby shower.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: As Darlene grapples with a life-altering offer, a conversation with David turns her world more upside-down.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: After Emilio's deportation, Jackie takes on a paternal role crafting a birth plan for Becky; Darlene navigates a love triangle with David and Ben; Harris faces her own dilemma.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Darlene struggles to decide between David and Ben; Becky begins to doubt herself as a mom; Mark gets in trouble at school when a picture of him and his boyfriend kissing goes viral

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Harris confronts Darlene's lifestyle; Jackie meddles in others' affairs to evade her own issues; Becky struggles with the expenses of parenthood, her family lends support.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Becky applies for a bartending job at Casita Bonita; Dan is concerned it could worsen her drinking.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: At Halloween, Jackie learns a shocking secret while trying to reopen the Lunch Box.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Jackie and Becky pitch their business plan to Darlene in hopes of getting the Lunch Box back, but Darlene's decision leads to hostility among the three.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Thanksgiving chaos erupts as Dan gathers the family; tensions rise over the Lunch Box; Harris surprises everyone with a bold move.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Jackie’s faced with a tough decision that brings the family and community together.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Dan is disappointed when everyone but Becky forgets about his birthday; Darlene faces another issue; Dan excludes Jackie from the family Christmas Santa photo for mistreating Louis

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: The Conners resist Becky's Packers fan boyfriend; Dan emphasizes family loyalty to the Bears to Mark; Ben and Darlene seek a loan for their magazine.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Darlene’s thrilled when Harris gets into Central Illinois State, but she may have other plans.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: The Conners debate voting reasons; Louise's offer threatens to take her from Lanford, prompting family intervention in Dan's relationship.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Dan avoids grief until it confronts him; Ben and Darlene tackle baby fever; Dwight's nervous to fill in for an injured chef.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Dan connects with his half-brother but struggles with their father's unequal treatment; Jackie hits it off with a fun married couple.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Darlene joins Price Warehouse for income; Jackie advances her relationship with Ron and Janelle; Ben alters his appearance for advertisers.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Harris returns home newly-unemployed; Becky seeks childcare; Jackie advises reaching out to Emilio's family; the family ponders tattoos.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Bev returns, wants to spread happiness with her money. She offers to fund Mark's coding camp tuition, but Darlene suggests giving it to Harris.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Dan’s ready to share his feelings with Louise; Darlene realizes how badly she wants a baby.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Dan and Louise deepen their bond amid the challenges of aging; Darlene's night in jail leaves Ben in charge of parenting; Mark's class experiment with a friend results in hickeys.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Darlene and Ben hunt for apartments; Jackie, Becky, and Beverly Rose road trip to Mexico to meet her father; Dan confides financial woes to Louise.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: The Conners are dealing with the pandemic and life's financial troubles; the Lunch Box is closed for everything but takeout and delivery.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Mary is devastated that Halloween has been canceled by the city, so Darlene and Becky enlist Jackie and the rest of the family to create an unforgettable experience.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Darlene isolates herself from her co-workers at Wellman Plastics, leaving them with the impression she is an elitist snob.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: It's Beverly Rose's first birthday -- but it's not all cake and candles -- when Becky and Emilio disagree on what kind of party they should have.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Darlene's friendship with a manager at Wellman Plastics lands her in an awkward situation; Louise's brother tries to win over Jackie.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Harris's job is in jeopardy after joining a protest she strongly believes in, leading to tense discussions within the family.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Ben's mom arrives after an unexpected death and unveils shocking information from the past; Becky and Emilio spend more time together.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Harris brings home her new friend, Josh, leaving the family questioning his intentions; Becky and Ben's attempt to build a closet stirs up family drama.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Darlene earns a promotion at Wellman Plastics, while Ben decides on a new career path; Jackie tries an herbal tea. and it leads to an emotional revelation.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Chuck's new purchase of a boat creates a rift; Darlene hires her first assistant at Wellman's Plastics but soon realizes she is anything but helpful.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Darlene starts to feel the pressures of her new job; Dan attempts to help Ben out at the hardware store, but the two don't always agree on how to run the business.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Mark is convinced he has COVID-19; Becky and Harris team up to confront Josh, who has been 'ghosting' Harris.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Dan feels helpless when Louise refuses to let him put himself at risk for her; when Jackie learns the competing restaurants are posting negative reviews.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Becky meets up with an old friend and feels pressured to impress him; Dan questions his position at the hardware store, leading to a massive fight between him and Ben.

programme.title: 1 vs. 100
programme.desc: Professional dancer Carrie Ann Inaba hosts this show in which a contestant can win $50,000. The contestant, known as the One, competes with a mob of 100 other players by answering questions. When the One answers correctly, each member of the mob that answered incorrectly is eliminated. The One earns money for each mob member who is eliminated. If the One can eliminate the entire mob, he wins $50,000. But if the One gets a question wrong, he is eliminated and the remaining mob members split his winnings.

programme.title: Wipeout Australia
programme.desc: It’s Sitcom Central on Wipeout Australia with the Odd Couple, starring World’s Strongest Dwarf, David Clarke and Gentle Giant, Tim Watts. Once again the Big Balls deliver some spectacular moments with an Italian Chef being sliced and diced. Sacks are introduced at the Sweeper proving too much for some, but surprisingly helping the ladies to even things out as we go into a 50/50 male, female split in the Wipeout Zone.

programme.title: Total Wipeout
programme.desc: You will see 10 celebrities get wet and repeatedly face tough obstacles in order to win the grand final.

programme.title: Wipeout Australia
programme.desc: Showdowns don’t come more epic than this. Pro Wrestler Mikey takes on Wipeout Australias very own Tom Cruise. Its neck and neck through the qualifier which this week includes a real Mission Impossible, Dirty Balls. The trash talk is as fierce as the competition and continues to the Wipeout Zone with the winner taking not only the $20,000 but also the glory. Australia is also introduced to a new kind of “violent love”, the Fight Hug.

programme.title: Wipeout Australia
programme.desc: Fashion comes to Wipeout Australia as we meet Adam “God’s Gift” Marshall, a self styled Ad man who conquers the Qualifier. Other Catwalk moments include the Grandpa in his Red Speedos and a Rainbow Bright Personal Ad. If jumping a revolving arm while balancing on a pedestal above water isn’t enough for you then you’ll love this weeks Sweeper. Contestants are armed with Dodgeballs, to be deployed at each other, creating horrific hits and spectacular spills. The Dizzy Dummy claims its first victim as Dummy Tummy rejects a contestant and the Wipeout Zone becomes a battle of young and old.

programme.title: Wipeout Australia
programme.desc: It’s no doubt that the ‘Ball Crusher’ Sweeper is the star of tonight’s show. With a brother- sister team hanging by a thread and a three-way hurdle, this week’s Sweeper writes itself into the History books. Tonight is also the night we meet Buffman, a pint sized Superhero with a twitch and a photo finish at the Dizzy Dummy threatens extinction to a Rare Breed. A week of action packed Wipeouts with Latin Dancing lotharios, what more can you ask for? And for the kids, a Fairy Tale, Wipeout Style!

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: A battle of the culinary world’s next generation comes to a head in this exciting two-hour finale showdown. The season began with 24 contestants, but now only three young chef-testants remain standing. The challenges this year were more intense, and more inspiring, than ever before. It’s a fight to the finish and only one will take it all home – the trophy, the coveted title of MASTERCHEF JUNIOR and the $100,000 grand prize. Watch as the home cooks dish up the best three-course meal of their lives, proving they have what it takes to win.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As the borders at Longmeadow hit their stride, it's time to take stock of what's looking good and what needs replacing. Monty shares his tips on how to keep the display going all summer long. There's plenty to do on the vegetable plot too and things are looking promising in the fruit garden.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty catches up with maintaining his pond and gives advice on planting water lilies. He also gives tips on how to grow and plant herbaceous clematis as well as harvesting potatoes. Nick Bailey begins his guide to demystifying roses, Arit Anderson takes a trip on a canal boat to find out how volunteers are bringing plants and wildlife back into the city of Birmingham, Mark Lane gives his guide on how to get the cottage style look into the garden.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Whether there is a heatwave or a downpour, Monty has plenty of jobs to be getting on with from pruning, propagating or planting pots. Adam Frost meets Prince Charles in his garden at Highgrove to talk about the issue of biosecurity, an issue which is of great concern to him and which could have a big effect on our gardens and landscape. Adam also talks to The Prince's Head Forester to find out what gardeners can do to help.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty advises on plants for a late summer display, tackles his overgrown wildlife pond and shows which roses to prune now for a repeat flowering in late summer. Frances Tophill travels to Birmingham where she shows that every space counts by transforming three tiny balconies into spaces full of colour and scent.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As summer unfolds at Longmeadow, Monty Don undertakes timely tasks in his vegetable garden and flower beds. Meanwhile, Carol Klein enjoys the beauty of one of our unsung native flowers, the geum, and visits a cottage garden which holds the national collection of cultivated forms. Plus, Formula 1 supremo Sir Frank Williams explains why he is opening his garden at Inholmes.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don looks ahead to the long Easter weekend by cutting back his grass borders. Meanwhile, Joe Swift reveals his top tips for creating a natural garden, and Carol Klein travels to Cornwall in search of a garden full of spring colour. Plus, the `living catalogue' of new and existing varieties of bedding plants at Ball Colegrave in Banbury, Oxfordshire.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don revels in his passion for roses as he sets about planting some bare root varieties in the Jewel Garden at Longmeadow in readiness for a colourful spring and summer. Continuing the rose theme, there is an inspirational visit to the magnificent formal rose garden of Hever Castle in Kent, home to a breathtaking collection of hybrid teas.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: The first big gardening weekend of the year gets underway with Monty dividing perennials and giving plenty of tips for how we can kick-start the garden for the season ahead. As millions of bedding plants are poised for planting in our pots and borders, Joe Swift visits a major grower to find out how they are produced and what drives the demand.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don has got advice on taking cuttings from favourite roses to bulk up stock for free. He is also sowing in the vegetable garden now for a winter salad harvest right up until Christmas, and planning ahead and planting a beautiful display of narcissi and foxgloves to enjoy next spring and summer. Meanwhile, Carol Kelin is at Glebe Cottage collecting seeds from her favourite flowering perennials.

programme.title: Monty Don's Italian Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don conducts a personal grand tour around Italy's magnificent gardens from the luxurious retreats of the moneyed north to the lavish hideaways of the romantic south. In this episode, he's in and around Rome, a powerbase of emperors and popes, to explore gardens that are among some of the most extravagant and flamboyant ever created in history.

programme.title: Monty Don's Italian Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don is on a grand tour around Italy, this time visiting gardens both in Florence and around the sun-scorched Tuscan countryside. Monty discovers how, like a piece of sculpture, renaissance gardens were created as works of art, and how a group of Edwardian ex-pats mistakenly reinforced the idea that formal Italian gardens were flowerless.

programme.title: Monty Don's Italian Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don continues his grand garden tour of Italy. This time he is in Naples to visit some of the most sublime, romantic retreats in southern Italy. After all the formality of the green gardens around Rome and Florence, Monty seeks out idyllic horticultural gems set against the dramatic scenery of the Amalfi Coast to discover why, in the south, gardens are informal and, above all, filled with flowers.

programme.title: Monty Don's Italian Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don concludes his garden tour of Italy in the wealthy north where, in the Veneto and Lucca, extravagant pleasure gardens were created for flirtation and fun. In the Lakes, Monty meets up with the garden society, the Grandi Giardini Italiani, to peer over the fence at luxurious creations of the rich and famous. The journey ends on Lake Maggiore to see the most theatrical horticultural gem of Italy.

programme.title: Monty Don's Adriatic Gardens
programme.desc: Monty travels to Europe and explores the influence of the Venetians on gardening. To begin with, he explores Venice on one of the city's famous barges, stepping out to visit green spaces large and small that are often hidden from view behind high walls.

programme.title: Monty Don's Adriatic Gardens
programme.desc: Monty begins in the city of Trieste, close to Italy's border with Croatia, to visit a public garden first created by an obsessive royal plantsman more than 150 years ago, which is now being carefully restored. He then heads down the Adriatic coast through Croatia to pick up the trail that the Venetians followed, ending his journey on the beautiful island of Lopud, near Dubrovnik.

programme.title: Monty Don's Adriatic Gardens
programme.desc: Monty begins the last leg of his journey in Corfu, a Greek island with strong Venetian links, including olive trees planted by them that are still grown today. Here, Monty visits a spectacular garden made by an Englishman with Greek connections.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: Monty Don is asked to rescue two nightmare outside spaces. In Salisbury, newly engaged Glenn and Zoe want a brand new garden and most of all they are desperate to produce flowers for their wedding. Currently their steeply sloping garden is completely unusable.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: Monty Don is asked to rescue two nightmare outside spaces. In Salisbury, newly engaged Glenn and Zoe want a brand new garden and most of all they are desperate to produce flowers for their wedding. Currently their steeply sloping garden is completely unusable.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: Monty Don is asked to rescue two nightmare outside spaces. In Salisbury, newly engaged Glenn and Zoe want a brand new garden and most of all they are desperate to produce flowers for their wedding. Currently their steeply sloping garden is completely unusable.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: Monty Don is asked to rescue two nightmare outside spaces. In Salisbury, newly engaged Glenn and Zoe want a brand new garden and most of all they are desperate to produce flowers for their wedding. Currently their steeply sloping garden is completely unusable.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As spring gets well underway, Monty Don adds to his collection of fritillaries at Longmeadow with pot-grown plants, as well as sowing some from seed. He also recommends other wildflowers which would thrive in the garden. Carol Klein meets Matt Bishop, who explains why he is attracted to later flowering varieties of daffodils and Rachel de Thame shows a viewer how to get to grips with pruning an overgrown shrubbery.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don has advice on how to successfully store an apple crop so it will last through winter and explains why he thinks it high time wall flowers came back into fashion. With tomatoes now over, Monty clears his greenhouse and plans for next year by planting garlic in the vegetable garden. Meanwhile, Carol is home at Glebe Cottage, dividing her perennials to continue the cost-effective stocking of her new beds.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: With the season well underway, there's plenty of work to be getting on with in the garden at Longmeadow and there's plenty to enjoy too. Monty Don will be undertaking some timely tasks to make sure the garden remains beautiful and productive all summer long. Joe Swift visits a garden transported, lock, stock and barrel to Britain from Japan around a hundred years ago.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty gets his new vegetable garden underway by making raised beds. He also offers advice on how to cut back herbs. Nick Bailey marks the 400th anniversary of the death of William Shakespeare when he investigates the fact and the fiction behind the Bard's potions and poisons, at the Chelsea Physic Garden; and we visit Pashley Manor in East Sussex to unearth the story behind the planting of over 25,000 tulips.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: With one of the driest summers in many years, Monty responds to viewers' questions and has plenty of advice on how to deal with drought conditions for vegetables, fruit, flowers and containers. Carol Klein celebrates one of the most flamboyant summer shrubs, the hydrangea.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: The vegetable garden is at its peak now and as well as harvesting, Monty takes a look at how his autumn crops are faring as well as giving tips on how to keep the garden looking at its best. Adam Frost returns to Leicester where he has been helping to create a garden from scratch on a new build estate, and Frances Tophill celebrates the summer harvest on her shared allotment.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: The team set out on a horticultural adventure to celebrate the south Asian influences on British gardens. Monty Don visits a Hindu temple in Neasden, London, to learn more about the melding of two cultures: the traditional Hindu Mandir and its suburban London location.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty has plenty of advice from pruning blackcurrants, taking cuttings and planting bulbs for flowering this Autumn. Carol Klein finds a collection of plants that are at their peak right now and gives her advice on how to grow one of the late summer garden stunners, the monarda while Adam Frost makes the finishing touches to the Leicestershire couple's garden which he helped them start from scratch.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: With one of the driest summers in many years, Monty responds to viewers' questions and has plenty of advice on how to deal with drought conditions for vegetables, fruit, flowers and containers. Carol Klein celebrates one of the most flamboyant summer shrubs, the hydrangea.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don is at RHS Garden Wisley in Surrey to learn from the experts there how easy alpines are to grow, which seeds are needed to plant a wildflower meadow and the best orchids to grow for each room in the house. Meanwhile, Carol Klein helps Britain in Bloom volunteer Michael Welsh, who is determined to bring colour to the former colliery town of Easington with a community garden.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As part of his planning for summer Monty begins to sow annual climbers and gets started on tidying and mulching his borders. In the last of Joe Swift's series on trees, he learns how and when to prune them, and why. We also meet clematis enthusiast, Mike Brown, whose collection fills his garden with colour all summer long, and amongst the brutalist architecture of London's Barbican, Nick Bailey, head gardener of the Chelsea Physic Garden, discovers a hidden tropical oasis.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don is planning ahead and planting autumn-flowering crocus at Longmeadow. Also for autumn colour, he's adding cyclamen to the spring garden, and has tips on how to get a great show from them. Meanwhile, Joe Swift visits Marks Hall - a surprising but inspiring modern garden and Carol Klein is in Staffordshire with a couple who've created a garden for all seasons in their half-acre plot.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: With the season well underway, there's plenty of work to be getting on with in the garden at Longmeadow and there's plenty to enjoy too. Monty Don will be undertaking some timely tasks to make sure the garden remains beautiful and productive all summer long. Joe Swift visits a garden transported, lock, stock and barrel to Britain from Japan around a hundred years ago.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As the growing season picks up a pace, Monty is sowing vegetables and planting out the scented plants, which he brought back from the Malvern Spring Festival. Carol is delving into the hedgerows and rooting at the bases of walls, fences and trees as she begins her journey to investigate why plants thrive in challenging conditions. We also return to Sissinghurst to find out about the changes Troy Scott-Smith is making to the world famous white garden.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: Monty Don is asked to rescue two nightmare outside spaces. In Salisbury, newly engaged Glenn and Zoe want a brand new garden and most of all they are desperate to produce flowers for their wedding. Currently their steeply sloping garden is completely unusable.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: Monty Don is asked to rescue two nightmare outside spaces. In Salisbury, newly engaged Glenn and Zoe want a brand new garden and most of all they are desperate to produce flowers for their wedding. Currently their steeply sloping garden is completely unusable.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: In Brighton determined duo Helen and Dax have their hands full with twins, one of whom has special needs. Meanwhile in High Wycombe, newly single Valerie is looking for a fresh lease of life.

programme.title: Monty Don's French Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don visits some of the most famous and interesting gardens in France. Here, he tells the stories behind France's important historic gardens. These include elaborate walled gardens designed to please the mistress - and then the wife - of a King, and magnificent displays of flowers and fountains that involved thousands of soldiers moving tracts of land and incited violent jealousy in another monarch.

programme.title: Monty Don's French Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don turns to the French love of food and finds out how this has influenced their gardens. He travels to some of the most famous `potager' or kitchen gardens, where vegetables and flowers are planted together in elaborate and beautiful displays. He also talks to gardeners about this style of planting which has been copied the world over.

programme.title: Monty Don's French Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don travels to some of the most celebrated artists' gardens, including the one created by the impressionist Claude Monet, who planted and painted his garden for half his life. Monty also matches the paintings to the garden of Paul Cezanne, as well as visiting several contemporary artistic gardens to see how the use of plants and trees has evolved into new and varied styles.

programme.title: Monty Don's American Gardens
programme.desc: Monty travels from Missouri to Chicago and then across to New York and Philadelphia. He begins his journey in a prairie, the original American flowering wilderness. Much of the prairie has disappeared but he meets a couple who have revived the tradition and enjoy showing it to him in full bloom.

programme.title: Monty Don's American Gardens
programme.desc: Monty goes South to explore gardens of early independent America and learns how the history of this part of the country is still very much evident in the places and people he meets. He visits the famous garden where President Thomas Jefferson, one of America's founding fathers, enjoyed spending his time seeking out seeds and plants for his thousand foot vegetable garden.

programme.title: Monty Don's American Gardens
programme.desc: Monty explores the extraordinary scenery of the west coast of America. He begins his journey in Arizona where he learns about cacti and marvels at the sight of them in the desert and in private gardens where they have replaced traditional plants and lawns.

programme.title: Monty Don's Adriatic Gardens
programme.desc: Monty travels to Europe and explores the influence of the Venetians on gardening. To begin with, he explores Venice on one of the city's famous barges, stepping out to visit green spaces large and small that are often hidden from view behind high walls.

programme.title: Monty Don's Adriatic Gardens
programme.desc: Monty begins in the city of Trieste, close to Italy's border with Croatia, to visit a public garden first created by an obsessive royal plantsman more than 150 years ago, which is now being carefully restored. He then heads down the Adriatic coast through Croatia to pick up the trail that the Venetians followed, ending his journey on the beautiful island of Lopud, near Dubrovnik.

programme.title: Monty Don's Adriatic Gardens
programme.desc: Monty begins the last leg of his journey in Corfu, a Greek island with strong Venetian links, including olive trees planted by them that are still grown today. Here, Monty visits a spectacular garden made by an Englishman with Greek connections.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don is back at the helm, but this time in the garden at his own Herefordshire home - a place that he has lovingly nurtured for the last 20 years. With winter receding, Monty, Carol Klein, Joe Swift and Rachel de Thame are preparing for spring. As well as showing us round his garden, Monty lifts and divides snowdrops and sows beetroot and plants onions. Monty also prunes his apple trees and trims his shrub roses.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don has got advice on taking cuttings from favourite roses to bulk up stock for free. He is also sowing in the vegetable garden now for a winter salad harvest right up until Christmas, and planning ahead and planting a beautiful display of narcissi and foxgloves to enjoy next spring and summer. Meanwhile, Carol Kelin is at Glebe Cottage collecting seeds from her favourite flowering perennials.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As April gets under way, Monty Don begins the process of reinvigorating his Jewel Garden where, over the coming months, he will be using plants which will give an evolving tapestry of colour over the seasons. Elsewhere, Carol Klein revels in the glory of one the world's most renowned camellia collections when she visits Mount Edgcumbe on the banks of the River Tamar in Cornwall.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: The vegetable garden is at its peak now and as well as harvesting, Monty takes a look at how his autumn crops are faring as well as giving tips on how to keep the garden looking at its best. Adam Frost returns to Leicester where he has been helping to create a garden from scratch on a new build estate, and Frances Tophill celebrates the summer harvest on her shared allotment.

programme.desc: Automotive journalist Henry Catchpole reviews new Ferrari 12 Cilindri and Aston Martin Vanquish. Both are powered by V-12 engines with the former being naturally aspirated and the latter adding a turbocharger.

programme.title: Chip Foose Draws a Car - Split-window Chevy Corvette and Jaguar E-Type
programme.desc: Part 1: Chip Foose customizes one of his dream cars: the 1963 split-window Chevy Corvette.Part 2: Chip Foose transforms the classic Jaguar E-type coupe into a streetwise sports car with even sleeker design elements.

programme.title: Revelations with Jason Cammisa | The Stories Behind Mercedes' 300SL and W124 500E
programme.desc: In this episode of Revelations, Jason Cammisa explores the fascinating histories behind two of Mercedes' most iconic cars.

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | Augie Pabst's Fiat "Double Bubble" and Cold War Military Tanks
programme.desc: Augie Pabst's Fiat "Double Bubble" and Cold War Military Tanks

programme.title: The Appraiser | Alfa Romeo GTV-6, a "K-Code" GT Mustang, and a Honda S2000
programme.desc: Colin Comer takes a look at a rust-free Alfa Romeo GTV-6, a "K-Code" Ford Mustang GT, and a 2004 Honda S2000 with only 80,0000 miles.

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | The woodie saves the day: One conversation leads to many finds
programme.desc: The woodie saves the day: One conversation leads to many finds.

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | AMC Rebel Machine, Triumph Stag, and a Porsche race car
programme.desc: AMC Rebel Machine, Triumph Stag, and a Porsche race car

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | Dusty Porsche 356 Speedster and an all-original Shelby GT500
programme.desc: In this episode of Barn Find Hunter, Tom Cotter talks with a woman with a dusty 1957 Porsche 356 A Speedster that she and her husband have owned since the 1960s. After that, Tom heads to his hometown and shows a stash of rare barn finds.

programme.title: The Driver's Seat with Henry Catchpole | The Lancia Delta S4 Stradale and a Lotus Elise restomod
programme.desc: Henry Catchpole drives one his dream cars, the Lancia Delta S4 Stradale.Next, Henry jumps in a Lotus Elise restomod that features some unique touches inspired by the legendary McLaren F1 supercar.

programme.title: The Driver's Seat with Henry Catchpole | A trio of incredible Mercedes sports cars
programme.desc: Henry drives Mercedes’ SLS AMG Black Series and AMG GT Black Series, two of the wildest, rarest, most expensive cars ever to emerge from Affalterbach.Next, another famous Merc takes center stage as Henry reviews the McLaren Mercedes SLR HDK.

programme.title: The Driver's Seat with Henry Catchpole | 2025 Aston Martin Vantage and Bentley Continental GT
programme.desc: Henry Catchpole reviews latest Aston Martin Vantage, equipped with a powerful twin-turbo V-8. Next, Henry drives the Bentley Continental GT which, while losing it's legendary W-12 engine, still provides a ton of fun via a hybrid-enhanced turbo V-8.

programme.title: The Big Thing with Magnus Walker | Gullwing Mercedes and the Maserati MC12
programme.desc: Urban Outlaw Magnus Walker drives the Mercedes-Benz W194, also known as the 300 SL. Next, he gets behind the wheel of the Maserati MC12.

programme.title: The Driver's Seat with Henry Catchpole
programme.desc: Automotive journalist Henry Catchpole reviews and drives the Ford Escort Mk1.

programme.title: Capturing Car Culture with Larry Chen
programme.desc: Larry Chen visits the largest tuning shop in Japan, the Liberty Walk headquarters.

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | Two Jaguar XKs a quarter-mile from one another
programme.desc: Two Jaguar XKs a quarter-mile from one another.

programme.title: Capturing Car Culture with Larry Chen
programme.desc: Larry Chen visits some of the legendary drivers and builders from Japan's Tuning Golden Age

programme.title: Dream Collections
programme.desc: Chris visits Dennis Varnišs car collection in San Jose, California.

programme.title: The Driver's Seat with Henry Catchpole
programme.desc: Automotive journalist Henry Catchpole drives the Ford Focus WRC and the Ford Focus RS.

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | Barn finds of the Owls Head Transportation Museum
programme.desc: What happens to barn finds if nobody buys them? Well, Tom Cotter finds out that some of them end up at Owls Head Transportation Museum in Owls Head, Maine. Next, Tom uncovers a "Frankenstein" Jaguar E-Type with a Chevy V-8 engine.

programme.title: The Driver's Seat with Henry Catchpole
programme.desc: Automotive journalist Henry Catchpole drives the TAG Turbo with the 700bhp RUF CTR.

programme.title: Revelations with Jason Cammisa | The Stories Behind Mazda's Miata and RX-7
programme.desc: The unlikely success story of the Mazda MX-5 Miata: the world's bestselling 2-seat roadster and the only remaining true lightweight sports car.The 3rd-gen Mazda RX-7 has it all: beauty, performance, a Le Mans tie-in, and a sales failure.

programme.title: The Next Big Thing with Magnus Walker | Lamborghini Espada, Ferrari 308 GT4, and Dodge Viper
programme.desc: Urban Outlaw Magnus Walker drives a Lamborghini Espada and Ferrari 308 GT4 in part one. After that, he jumps in a Dodge Viper. Follow along as he makes the argument as to why these vehicles might be The Next Big Thing in the collector car world

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | Mazda RX-7s, RX-5s, RX-3s and Datsun Z-Cars
programme.desc: Mazda RX-7s, RX-5s, RX-3s and Datsun Z-Cars

programme.title: Ultimate Drag Race Replay - Hyundai Ioniq 5 N vs Super SUVS | Cadillic LeMans race car
programme.desc: Host Jason Cammisa races the Hyundai Ioniq 5 N against the Lamboghini Urus, Porsche Macan GTS, Jaguar F-Pace SVR and Alfa Romeo Grecale Trofeo. Next, he races Cadillac's Le Mans hypercar vs the Ferrari 296, McLaren 750S, and Porsche 911 Turbo S.

programme.title: Revelations with Jason Cammisa | Chevy Corvette ZR-1 and GMC Cyclone
programme.desc: This episode of Revelations with Jason Cammisa starts off with the fascinating story behind the ZR-1 Corvette. After that, Jason dives into GMC Syclone, which was the world's fastest pickup truck... for 30 years!

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | RARE: Vincent Black Shadows - Harley-Davidsons - Indian Motorcycle Collection
programme.desc: RARE: Vincent Black Shadows - Harley-Davidsons - Indian Motorcycle Collection

programme.title: RadVentures | Defender and Range Rover off-roading, Ford F-150 Lighting racing
programme.desc: There's lots of fun to be had in these 80's and 90's icons! In this episode of RadVentures, Ryan Symancek goes offroading in a couple old Land Rovers. Next, a 700HP Ford SVT Lighting and $1500 Flareside F-150 go head-to-head on the track.

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | Low-mileage Buick Grand National and a restoration shop disaster
programme.desc: Tom Cotter starts off this episode finding a stash of cars that includes a 1984 Buick Grand National press car. After that, Tom visits the remains of an amazing Woodie restoration shop that burned completely to the ground.

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | $900 Richard Petty engine, Ford Galaxies and a rare Mach 1 Mustang
programme.desc: Tom Cotter meets "Snowball" Bishop, tours his personal junkyard, and gets some great stories about NASCAR and dirt track racing from the "good ol' days." Next, Tom gets the details on a rare Ford Mustang Mach 1 with a factory 429 Cobra Jet engine.

programme.title: The Driver's Seat with Henry Catchpole
programme.desc: Automotive journalist Henry Catchpole reviews and drives the Porsche 911 GT3.

programme.desc: Larry Chen attends Retro Havoc in Malaysia.

programme.title: AFTCO Original Film
programme.desc: Set in Wisconsin, “Up North” explores the passion and pursuit of the midwestern angler. Whether they’re breaking ice on Green Bay to chase trophy walleye or traveling up to the Northwoods to carry on years of family traditions, Kaitlin and Josh Woodward embody a passion for fishing in its truest form. After fishing together for nearly 11 years, the Woodwards started a part-time guiding business in 2019 called Woodward Fishing to share their passion for their own Wisconsin waters. Some of Kaitlin’s favorite memories on the water have been in Green Bay chasing trophy fish; she recounts, “Every cast was a pre-spawn 25” -27” walleye; it was unreal.” Their teamwork and drive on the water are unmatched. Josh brings his determination to find the fish, and Kaitlin brings her tenacity and ability to get everyone back to the purity of nature no matter what the day brings.They have guided together for the past four years in the Northwoods of Wisconsin and Green Bay, and both areas hold an equally special place for the Woodwards. Josh cut his teeth fishing in Green Bay and Sturgeon Bay with his grandfather and grew up going to the Northwoods with his family. These traditions have become a way of life for Josh and Kaitlin as their year revolves around making the most of the season in both locations with their favorite boat dog, Kimber, in tow. “My family was here before my time, and now we’re going to pass that on to our kids.” – Josh WoodwardFollow their adventures as they put AFTCO fishing rain gear to the test in our newest AFTCO Original Film, “Up North.”

Mark is still sharing the blind with Matt Gindorff, a WTA consultant, and they discuss waterfowl hunting in Argentina and how it compares to that of the U.S.

programme.title: FinQuest
programme.desc: In Episode 4 of FinQuest, Ryan Miller explores Jupiter’s Inner Coastal Waterway, blending fishing, paddleboarding, and community engagement. With the help of Matthew from Jupiter Live Bait, Ryan showcases bait preparation techniques before catching snook in the vibrant ICW. He highlights Jupiter's community spirit by joining a local clean-up initiative with Jeremy from Blue Line Paddleboards. The episode features paddleboarding adventures with Ryan’s family, connecting with nature and marine life, and ends with a conservation message about preserving Jupiter’s pristine environment.

programme.title: FinQuest
programme.desc: In Episode 5 of FinQuest, Ryan Miller dives into the vibrant world of offshore fishing off the coast of Palm Beach County. Joined by Cabo Mike, they showcase expert bait techniques and strategies, reeling in a variety of catches, including bonita and a stunning mahi mahi. The duo shares insights into their fishing setup, explains the use of daisy chains, and celebrates their exciting day at sea. With breathtaking views of the ocean and a colorful array of fish, Ryan’s passion for saltwater fishing shines through. The episode wraps up with a reflection on the beauty and bounty of Palm Beach County waters.

programme.title: Dirt
programme.desc: In our final episode in Japan, the DIRT team went road-tripping through beautiful, snowy Japanese landscapes—and tasting everything in sight. A crown jewel in the northeast corner of Japan, Hokkaido may be famous among skiers and snowboarders for the luscious "Japow," but way beyond the tourist trail there's a burgeoning new food scene and a unique and vibrant history. Though, if we're honest, Josh probably could've spent the whole trip carving up the mountain and been a happy camper.

programme.title: Dirt
programme.desc: Episode one hits close to home. Specifically, Josh’s hometown of Seattle where we travel from the mountains to the coast in pursuit of local ingredients for an authentic Washington meal. Digging for forest delicacies, hunting for exotic bivalves, and exploring the tidal flats of a multi-generational shellfish farm—it’s all on the menu.

programme.title: Winchester Life

Join Team Winchester as they stalk, call, flank and roost boss gobblers into range from coast to coast.

Mark is still sharing the blind with Matt Gindorff, a WTA consultant, and they discuss waterfowl hunting in Argentina and how it compares to that of the U.S.

programme.title: FinQuest
programme.desc: In Episode 4 of FinQuest, Ryan Miller explores Jupiter’s Inner Coastal Waterway, blending fishing, paddleboarding, and community engagement. With the help of Matthew from Jupiter Live Bait, Ryan showcases bait preparation techniques before catching snook in the vibrant ICW. He highlights Jupiter's community spirit by joining a local clean-up initiative with Jeremy from Blue Line Paddleboards. The episode features paddleboarding adventures with Ryan’s family, connecting with nature and marine life, and ends with a conservation message about preserving Jupiter’s pristine environment.

programme.title: FinQuest
programme.desc: In Episode 5 of FinQuest, Ryan Miller dives into the vibrant world of offshore fishing off the coast of Palm Beach County. Joined by Cabo Mike, they showcase expert bait techniques and strategies, reeling in a variety of catches, including bonita and a stunning mahi mahi. The duo shares insights into their fishing setup, explains the use of daisy chains, and celebrates their exciting day at sea. With breathtaking views of the ocean and a colorful array of fish, Ryan’s passion for saltwater fishing shines through. The episode wraps up with a reflection on the beauty and bounty of Palm Beach County waters.

A crown jewel in the northeast corner of Japan, Hokkaido may be famous among skiers and snowboarders for the luscious "Japow," but way beyond the tourist trail there's a burgeoning new food scene and a unique and vibrant history. Though, if we're honest, Josh probably could've spent the whole trip carving up the mountain and been a happy camper.

programme.title: Dirt

programme.desc: After his friend and business partner gets murdered, a retired FBI agent sets out to find out who did it and make them pay for it.

programme.title: Heartsounds
programme.desc: A near-fatal heart attack sends a New York urologist and his writer wife into a battle against a medical institution unable or unwilling to help him.

programme.title: Falling from Grace
programme.desc: A country singer, caught between the woman he loves and the woman he once loved, must make a decision affecting all of their lives.

programme.title: Lost in Yonkers
programme.desc: A film adaptation of Neil Simon's Pulitzer Prize-winning comedy/drama that follows the escapades and tragedies of an unusual family in 1942 Yonkers.

programme.title: Private Valentine: Blonde & Dangerous
programme.desc: Megan Valentine was America's sweetheart. After the movie star suddenly becomes broke, she joins the Army, learning to live a life without luxury.

programme.title: First Target
programme.desc: A group of deadly assassins targets the US President as he tours a state park aboard a tram, and it's up to Secret Service agent, Alex, to stop them.

programme.title: The Greatest
programme.desc: Boxer Cassius Clay (Muhammad Ali) trains with Angelo Dundee (Ernest Borgnine), becomes heavyweight champion and converts to Islam.

programme.title: The Shadow Riders
programme.desc: Two brothers return home after the Civil War to find that their family has been kidnapped by a marauding band of rebel Confederate guerrillas.

programme.title: Silverado
programme.desc: In the 1800s Old West, an unlikely band of misfit friends teams up in a shoot-em-up against a frontier town’s crooked sheriff and his henchmen.

programme.title: The Magic Carpet
programme.desc: When his parents, the caliph and queen, are murdered by usurper Ali (Gregory Gaye), the newborn Ramoth is delivered to the safety of his uncle, Ahkmid (William Fawcett), via a magic carpet. The adult Ramoth (John Agar) becomes masked hero the Scarlet Falcon. After tricking the reigning caliph into appointing him the royal physician, Ramoth learns of his noble birth and, with the help of faithful Razi (George Tobias) and beautiful Lida (Patricia Medina), he fights Ali and his wrathful minions.

programme.title: It Should Happen to You
programme.desc: A young model finds her dreams of fame coming true when she rents billboards in New York to advertise herself, attracting fans and two rival suitors.

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: This steamy pot-boiler follows the intrigues surrounding an escaped convict who attempts to return to the small southern town where he grew up.

programme.title: Bad for Each Other
programme.desc: Wooed by a Pittsburgh socialite, an idealistic doctor from a mining town is torn between helping his community and lucrative work at an elite clinic.

programme.title: Decameron Nights
programme.desc: While trying to woo a noblewoman in Florence, Italian poet Boccaccio tells three tales of love in this romance based on the author's writings.

programme.title: All the Young Men
programme.desc: After taking command of a Marine platoon during the Korean War, a Black sergeant struggles to rally the white soldiers to complete a critical mission.

programme.title: The Whole Truth
programme.desc: Bored with his marriage, a movie producer has an affair with a temperamental actress. When she ends up murdered, all clues point to him as the killer.

programme.title: Fail Safe
programme.desc: A malfunction inadvertently sends American planes armed with nuclear warheads to Russia in a blunder of potentially apocalyptic proportions.

programme.title: Miss Sadie Thompson
programme.desc: In postwar Honolulu, a former sex worker finds herself courted by a love-struck Marine as a religious zealot sets his sights on reforming her.

programme.title: No Sad Songs for Me
programme.desc: Upon being diagnosed with terminal cancer, selfless suburban housewife Mary Scott (Margaret Sullavan) makes the ultimate sacrifice: she decides to keep the unpleasant news from her husband, Brad (Wendell Corey), and daughter, Polly, to avoid devastating her loved ones. Instead, Mary encourages Brad's affair with a co-worker (Viveca Lindfors), and even grooms the other woman to take her place. But as Mary's illness progresses, keeping it a secret presents a considerable challenge.

programme.title: Gidget (1959)
programme.desc: Things turn around for a sad-faced teen who can’t measure up to the chesty, bikini babes on the beach when two surfers start paying her attention.

programme.title: Autumn Leaves
programme.desc: An aging, lonely spinster marries a good-looking younger man only to find that he has a very tormented past and is mentally disturbed.

programme.title: Let's Do It Again!
programme.desc: In this 1953 musical remake of The Awful Truth, a recently-divorced couple try every way to make each other jealous.

programme.title: First Comes Courage
programme.desc: Beautiful Norwegian woman Nicole Larsen (Merle Oberon) is dedicated to the local resistance movement, and seduces Nazi officer Paul Dichter (Carl Esmond) in order to gain information that will help to defeat the Germans. Complicating matters for Nicole are both the difficulty of her loathsome undercover work and the appearance of an old flame, handsome English soldier Allan Lowell (Brian Aherne), who would like nothing more than to reunite with her.

programme.title: Meet the Stewarts
programme.desc: When a boy from modest means marries his rich, pampered finacé, squabbles over budget threaten to tear the lovebirds apart in this charming rom-com.

programme.title: The Trouble with Angels
programme.desc: A Reverend Mother faces an uphill battle to reform a pair of young, hard-to-reach troublemakers who’ve been wreaking havoc on her convent school.

programme.title: Oliver Twist
programme.desc: In this adaptation of the classic Charles Dickens novel, an orphan on the streets of London is welcomed into a household of trained pickpockets.

programme.title: The Long Gray Line
programme.desc: An Irish immigrant who found a home in the Army as a West Point instructor becomes very close to his pupils, one of whom is Dwight Eisenhower.

programme.title: The Mating of Millie
programme.desc: A businesswoman (Evelyn Keyes) asks a bachelor (Glenn Ford) to help her find a husband so she can adopt an orphan.

programme.title: It Happened to Jane
programme.desc: When a shipment of expired shellfish arrives to her New England lobstery, Jane Osgood decides to take a capitalist railroad tycoon to court.

programme.title: The Notorious Landlady
programme.desc: After falling for his charming landlady, an American diplomat in London learns that she's suspected of murder and tries to help her clear her name.

programme.title: Divorce American Style
programme.desc: A nouveau-riche L.A. couple decide to call it quits after 17 years of marriage, but alimony woes send the bachelor in search of a husband for his ex.

programme.title: The Fuller Brush Girl
programme.desc: Fired from her job as a switchboard operator, a daffy young woman tries her hand at door-to-door cosmetics sales only to get mixed up in a murder rap.

programme.title: Only Angels Have Wings
programme.desc: Rough and tough Geoff Carter (Cary Grant) runs a tiny airline that cannot afford to miss any flights, despite the dangers along many of the routes. When Bonnie Lee (Jean Arthur), a performer who is falling for him, sees that Geoff is preparing to fly in violent weather conditions, she takes measures to make him stay. She's successful in her attempt, and two of his employees are forced to make the flight for him -- but Bonnie may have been correct about the potential peril of that flight.

programme.title: Sierra Stranger
programme.desc: Jess Collins, a poor miner, helps Sonny chase off two men he calls claim jumpers. When he arrives in the nearby town, he learns Sonny is no good and everyone in town is against him.

programme.title: Hangman's Knot
programme.desc: Major Matt Stewart (Randolph Scott) leads a troop of Confederate soldiers on a raid, targeting a wagon that is transporting Union gold. All of the Union soldiers are killed except for one, who informs Stewart that the war had already ended a month ago. Stewart leads the troop into hiding, knowing they could face murder charges. After capturing a coach driven by nurse Molly Hull (Donna Reed), the soldiers try to evade a group of bandits chasing them to steal the gold.

programme.title: 40 Guns to Apache Pass
programme.desc: A cavalry captain (Audie Murphy) rescues settlers and catches a corporal (Kenneth Tobey) selling rifles to Apaches.

programme.title: The Range Feud
programme.desc: When a murder occurs during a range war, a sheriff (Buck Jones) investigates to clear an innocent man (John Wayne).

programme.title: Dirty Little Billy
programme.desc: After his family moves to a frontier town in Kansas, city-bred teenager Billy Bonney (Michael J. Pollard) finds he has no appetite for farming. He runs away, taking up with local outlaw Goldie (Richard Evans), who operates a saloon in town with the help of a prostitute named Berle (Lee Purcell). The three form a gang of sorts, menacing the locals until the townsfolk collectively decide to drive the outlaws away. Bonney escapes and begins the life of crime that makes him famous as Billy the Kid.

programme.title: Terror Trail
programme.desc: The Durango Kid (Charles Starrett) heads off a range war over cattle and sheep.

programme.title: Gunman's Walk
programme.desc: Rancher Lee Hackett (Van Heflin) spends so much time trying to keep the violent streak of his son Ed (Tab Hunter) in check, he neglects the needs of his other son Davy (James Darren). When Ed's temper results in the death of an innocent Native American, Lee tries his best to cover his son's tracks by making a deal with unscrupulous horse trader Jensen (Ray Teal), who falsely testifies on Ed's behalf. But it becomes clear that Ed can't change, and a shootout between father and son ensues.

programme.title: The Hellions
programme.desc: A small-town policeman (Richard Todd) stands alone against a family of outlaws in 19th-century South Africa.

programme.title: The Gun That Won the West
programme.desc: Superior Springfield rifles help scouts (Dennis Morgan, Richard Denning) and the cavalry get forts built in Wyoming.

programme.title: Relentless
programme.desc: Framed for a murder he didn't commit, a cowboy hides with a traveling woman as he flees a sheriff and hunts for the real killer.

programme.title: 7th Cavalry
programme.desc: Returning to Fort Lincoln, Capt. Benson learns of Custer's defeat at the Little Big Horn. At the inquiry as Custer's officers blame Custer for the defeat, Benson tries to defend him. However, Benson was suspiciously absent at the time of the battle and is now despised by the troops. So when an order to retrieve the bodies from the battlefield arrives, Benson volunteers for the dangerous mission of returning back into Indian territory.

programme.title: Gunfighters
programme.desc: Brazos Kane, a gunslinger who's vowed to kill no more, goes to work for a land baron on a ranch, where he is unjustly accused of murder.

programme.title: Texas Cyclone
programme.desc: A traveling cowboy visits an unusual town where everyone assumes he is a man who was once presumed to be dead, including the man’s wife.

programme.title: The Longest Drive
programme.desc: After a decade apart, a pair of brothers reunites to find their long-lost sister, who was kidnapped as a child and is now living with a native tribe.

programme.title: A Man Called Sledge
programme.desc: In the Old West, a gunfighting outlaw connives his way into a jail with the goal of stealing a large shipment of gold stored in the prison.

programme.title: North From the Lone Star
programme.desc: Wild Bill Hickok (Bill Elliott) puts on a badge to clean up a town.

programme.title: Lust for Gold
programme.desc: During the 1870s, the ruthless Jacob Walz (Glenn Ford) becomes very wealthy after locating a legendary Arizona gold mine and securing sole ownership by murdering his partner. Walz then travels to Phoenix, where he catches the attention of a beautiful and crafty woman named Julia Thomas (Ida Lupino), who has learned of his exploits. Eventually, Walz falls in love with Julia, unaware that she's already married to Pete (Gig Young), who is eyeing his fortune.

programme.title: Whirlwind Raiders
programme.desc: The Durango Kid (Charles Starrett) and his singing sidekick (Smiley Burnette) stop bogus Texas lawmen.

programme.title: Pecos River
programme.desc: The Durango Kid (Charles Starrett) and his singing sidekick (Smiley Burnette) catch mail robbers.

programme.title: Desert Vigilante
programme.desc: The Durango Kid (Charles Starrett) bags Mexican-border silver smugglers for Uncle Sam.

programme.title: Arizona
programme.desc: Phoebe Titus (Jean Arthur) is a tough-as-nails pioneer with dreams of starting a freight service in Tuscon, Ariz. Peter Muncie (William Holden), a vagabond passing through Arizona en route to California, takes a romantic interest in Phoebe and coaxes out her softer side. Just as their romance begins to blossom, Peter packs up and moves on. Though charming southerner Jefferson Carteret (Warren William) steps in to lend a hand, he may be plotting in secret to sabotage Phoebe's nascent business.

programme.title: Sierra Stranger
programme.desc: Jess Collins, a poor miner, helps Sonny chase off two men he calls claim jumpers. When he arrives in the nearby town, he learns Sonny is no good and everyone in town is against him.

programme.title: Hangman's Knot
programme.desc: Major Matt Stewart (Randolph Scott) leads a troop of Confederate soldiers on a raid, targeting a wagon that is transporting Union gold. All of the Union soldiers are killed except for one, who informs Stewart that the war had already ended a month ago. Stewart leads the troop into hiding, knowing they could face murder charges. After capturing a coach driven by nurse Molly Hull (Donna Reed), the soldiers try to evade a group of bandits chasing them to steal the gold.

programme.title: Comanche Station
programme.desc: When solitary cowboy Jefferson Cody (Randolph Scott) hears tales of a white woman living as a captive of the Comanche tribe, he rides deep into the tribe's territory to exchange goods for her freedom. As Cody escorts the captive woman away, he learns that she is Nancy Lowe (Nancy Gates), and that there is a sizable reward offered by her husband for her return. Cody and Mrs. Lowe must brave ruthless bounty hunters greedy for the reward, as well as the now-warring Comanches, to make it to safety.

programme.title: Cripple Creek
programme.desc: A federal agent (George Montgomery) and two colleagues infiltrate a gang of gold-rush gold smugglers.

programme.title: The Texican
programme.desc: Deputy Jess Carlin (Audie Murphy) leaves his Texas hometown in disgrace, framed by corrupt saloon owner Luke Starr (Broderick Crawford) for a crime he didn't commit. When his brother, muckraking newspaper editor Roy Carlin (Víctor Vilanova), is murdered after printing an exposé of Starr's crooked deals, Carlin returns home from the Mexican border town where he's been holed up and enlists his brother's fiancée (Luz Márquez) and saloon dancer Kit O'Neal (Diana Lorys) to bring Starr down.

programme.title: Decision at Sundown

programme.title: Go West, Young Lady
programme.desc: A vicious outlaw called Pecos Pete (Onslow Stevens) has long tormented the peaceful residents of a small frontier town. So these desperate people hire a dedicated new sheriff, Tex Miller (Glenn Ford), to bring this ruffian to justice. But, for all his determination, Tex is tricked by Pete and led into an ambush. Ultimately, it is the wily and brassy transplant Belinda "Bill" Pendergast (Penny Singleton) who uncovers Pete's true identity and plots a way to run him out of town once and for all.

programme.title: Gunmen From Laredo

programme.title: The Nevadan

programme.title: Masterson of Kansas
programme.desc: In the 1870s, Marshal Wyatt Earp (Bruce Cowling) calls upon Dodge City, Kan., Sheriff Bat Masterson (George Montgomery) to track down rancher Merrick (John Maxwell), who is accused of murder. But, thanks to some proof held by local Native American Chief Yellow Hawk (Jay Silverheels), Masterson realizes Merrick might be the victim of a frame-up. So, with the help of Earp and gunfighter Doc Holliday (James Griffith), Masterson sets out to find those who are really behind the killing.
